page.title: 19OTHER LAND USE NEAR YANWORTH
page.content: The{woods}are too small for viable commmercial forestry. A saw mill and equipment only supplies gates, fences etc. for the estate. The Coln is maintained to allow {private trout fishing parties. Extensive rearing and releasing of{partridges-pheasants}allows private shooting parties after November, when pheasants are wilder and give 'better' shooting. A very limited 3 days of outside hiring is very lucrative. Increasing concern to preserve the rural environment of the estate is shown in the planting of over 400 specimen trees -{silviculture. }A full time{waller}is employed to repair and restore field boundaries. The large private acreage of dense woodland with limited public access means{wild life }including fallow and muntjac deer can live in some peace.
